text: Thomas Fitz Sealy (February 23, 1921 – November 29, 2000) was a former professional basketball player. He was a member of the Harlem Globetrotters. He also played for the Dayton Rens of the National Basketball League. Sealy was featured in the film Tommy and the Basketball. He was an active player in 1946 for the Harlem Globetrotters. Sealy was 6'2" and played for Brooklyn College. He played all 40 games for the Rens in the 1948-49 season, finishing the season as their 5th leading scorer with 260 points (6.5 points per game). He died in November 2000. ==References== Category:1921 births Category:2000 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:American army personnel of World War II Category:Basketball players from Pennsylvania Category:Brooklyn Bulldogs men's basketball players Category:Dayton Rens players Category:Detroit Vagabond Kings players Category:Harlem Globetrotters players Category:New York Renaissance players Category:Sportspeople from Philadelphia Category:Guards (basketball) Category:Brooklyn College alumni
title: Tom Sealy
